Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the defined coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal axis by 0.75 units. The generated part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with the following dimensions, as inferred from the VLM model: - Shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at a right angle. The front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. For the sketch, create a face (face\\_1) with one loop (loop\\_1), which includes a single circle (circle\\_1): - In the center, define the circle at [0.225, 0.225] with a radius of 0.225. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.45. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the defined coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal axis by 0.75 units. Perform a cut operation on the extruded 3D solid using the current shape. The resulting part will be a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom, symmetrical along its central axis, with the following dimensions from the VLM model: - Shape: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom.
